instruction: What kinds of spectrum were used in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images using an improved convolutional neural network?
Output: The related study used remote sensing spectrum in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images using an improved convolutional neural network.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images using an improved convolutional neural network?
Output: Radial basis function and support vector machine were used in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images using an improved convolutional neural network.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification results of the improved convolutional neural network and how far can this metric go in terms of accuracy?
Output: The metric chosen to evaluate the classification results of the improved convolutional neural network is the overall accuracy. The overall accuracy measures the percentage of correctly classified pixels in the remote sensing images. According to the related study, the overall accuracy of the improved convolutional neural network classification method has reached 97% above.

instruction: What traditional methods were compared with the improved convolutional neural network in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images?
Output: The traditional methods that were compared with the improved convolutional neural network in the classification of high-resolution remote sensing images are radial basis functions and support vector machine.

instruction: Can the improved convolutional neural network method achieve better accuracy in classifying high-resolution remote sensing images compared to traditional methods such as radial basis functions and support vector machine?
Output: Yes, the improved convolutional neural network method can achieve better accuracy in classifying high-resolution remote sensing images compared to traditional methods such as radial basis functions and support vector machine. The related study presented classification results of hyperspectral images, showing that the improved method performed better in overall accuracy and Kappa coefficient. The commission errors of the support vector machine classification method were more than 6 times that of the improved convolutional neural network classification method. Additionally, the overall accuracy of the improved convolutional neural network classification method reached 97% or above.
